sn45.18:1.2: At one time the venerables Ānanda and Bhadda were staying at Pāṭaliputta, in the Chicken Monastery.
sn45.18:1.3: Then in the late afternoon, Venerable Bhadda came out of retreat, went to Venerable Ānanda, and exchanged greetings with him.
sn45.18:1.4: When the greetings and polite conversation were over, he sat down to one side and said to Ānanda:
sn45.18:2.1: “Reverend, they speak of this thing called ‘not the spiritual path’.
sn45.18:2.2: What is not the spiritual path?”
sn45.18:2.4: Your approach and articulation are excellent, and it’s a good question.
sn45.18:2.6: ‘They speak of this thing called “not the spiritual path”.
sn45.18:2.7: What is not the spiritual path?’”
sn45.18:2.9: “What is not the spiritual path is simply the wrong eightfold path, that is:
sn45.18:2.10: wrong view, wrong thought, wrong speech, wrong action, wrong livelihood, wrong effort, wrong mindfulness, and wrong immersion.”
